str2: Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
(Hebrew) Noah. Of Hebrew origin; Noe, a patriarch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From chrema; to utter an oracle, i.e. Divinely intimate; by implication, to constitute a firm for business, i.e. bear as a title.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Not yet. From mede and po; not even yet.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To fear, be anxious, be cautious; To reverence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of skeuos; to prepare thoroughly; by implication, to construct, create.
A box, i.e. The sacred ark and that of Noah.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From kleros and the base of nomos (reflexively) getting by apportionment); a sharer by lot, i.e. Inheritor; by implication, a possessor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
